result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Prosecuting Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Akia Janette L. Harris in court and by Attorney Edgar A. Beltran. Resolution reached with joint recommendation.  State moves to amend the sole charge to 3 counts of Misd. Retail Theft pursuant to sec. 943.50(1m)(b)(4)(a) and Court so orders.  State to file an amended Information.  No contest plea entered on Cts. 1, 2 and 3 as amended.  Court finds defendant guilty on Cts. 1, 2 and 3 as amended.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

Prosecuting Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Akia Janette L. Harris in court and by Attorney Edgar A. Beltran. Reading of Information waived.  Not guilty plea entered.
Per request of Atty. Beltran, 9-27-2022 arraignment rescheduled to 10-19-2022 at 9:45 a.m.

District Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Akia JL Harris in court and by Attorney Edgar A. Beltran.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.
Arraignment scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Prosecuting Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant in custody and by Atty. Timothy Drewa. Co-defendant cases with Destiny Earl 22CF353 and Tyesha Earl 22CF354.  Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant eligible for State Public Defender.  Argument on bond.  $2,500 signature bond set.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.
